channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: LongBoX: Evaluating Transformers on Long-Sequence Clinical Tasks
item.description: Assessing these models on long sequences is crucial since prior work in the general domain has demonstrated performance degradation of LLMs on longer texts.

item.title: JaxMARL: Multi-Agent RL Environments in JAX
item.description: This not only enables GPU acceleration, but also provides a more flexible MARL environment, unlocking the potential for self-play, meta-learning, and other future applications in MARL.

item.title: Back to Basics: A Simple Recipe for Improving Out-of-Domain Retrieval in Dense Encoders
item.description: Prevailing research practice today often relies on training dense retrievers on existing large datasets such as MSMARCO and then experimenting with ways to improve zero-shot generalization capabilities to unseen domains.

item.title: ARES: An Automated Evaluation Framework for Retrieval-Augmented Generation Systems
item.description: Evaluating retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems traditionally relies on hand annotations for input queries, passages to retrieve, and responses to generate.

item.title: Spatial Bayesian Neural Networks
item.description: We also show that a single SBNN can be used to represent a variety of spatial processes often used in practice, such as Gaussian processes and lognormal processes.

item.title: Gradual Source Domain Expansion for Unsupervised Domain Adaptation
item.description: Unsupervised domain adaptation (UDA) tries to overcome the need for a large labeled dataset by transferring knowledge from a source dataset, with lots of labeled data, to a target dataset, that has no labeled data.

item.title: INTERVENOR: Prompt the Coding Ability of Large Language Models with the Interactive Chain of Repairing
item.description: The Code Learner is asked to generate and repair code according to the instructions from the Code Teacher.

item.title: Gradient-Map-Guided Adaptive Domain Generalization for Cross Modality MRI Segmentation
item.description: Cross-modal MRI segmentation is of great value for computer-aided medical diagnosis, enabling flexible data acquisition and model generalization.

item.title: Weakly Supervised Anomaly Detection for Chest X-Ray Image
item.description: Chest X-Ray (CXR) examination is a common method for assessing thoracic diseases in clinical applications.

item.title: MS-Former: Memory-Supported Transformer for Weakly Supervised Change Detection with Patch-Level Annotations
item.description: How to capture the semantic variations associated with the changed and unchanged regions from the patch-level annotations to obtain promising change results is the critical challenge for the weakly supervised change detection task.

item.title: CDMPP: A Device-Model Agnostic Framework for Latency Prediction of Tensor Programs
item.description: Considering the large space of DNN models and devices that impede direct profiling of all combinations, recent efforts focus on building a predictor to model the performance of DNN models on different devices.

item.title: Zenkai -- Framework For Exploring Beyond Backpropagation
item.description: Zenkai aims to make it easier to get around these limitations and help researchers more easily explore new frontiers in deep learning that do not strictly adhere to the backpropagation framework.

item.title: Where Do People Tell Stories Online? Story Detection Across Online Communities
item.description: People share stories online for a myriad of purposes, whether as a means of self-disclosure, processing difficult personal experiences, providing needed information or entertainment, or persuading others to share their beliefs.

item.title: An Attention-Based Denoising Framework for Personality Detection in Social Media Texts
item.description: In social media networks, users produce a large amount of text content anytime, providing researchers with a valuable approach to digging for personality-related information.

item.title: What Constitutes a Faithful Summary? Preserving Author Perspectives in News Summarization
item.description: In this work, we take a first step towards designing summarization systems that are faithful to the author's opinions and perspectives.

item.title: BLT: Can Large Language Models Handle Basic Legal Text?
item.description: We find that the best publicly available LLMs like GPT-4 and PaLM 2 currently perform poorly at basic text handling required of lawyers or paralegals, such as looking up the text at a line of a witness deposition or at a subsection of a contract.

item.title: Neuro-Symbolic Integration Brings Causal and Reliable Reasoning Proofs
item.description: Though prompting LLMs with various reasoning structures produces reasoning proofs along with answers, these proofs are not ensured to be causal and reliable due to the inherent defects of LLMs.

item.title: PWISeg: Point-based Weakly-supervised Instance Segmentation for Surgical Instruments
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel yet effective weakly-supervised surgical instrument instance segmentation approach, named Point-based Weakly-supervised Instance Segmentation (PWISeg).

item.title: Comparing Differentiable Logics for Learning Systems: A Research Preview
item.description: Extensive research on formal verification of machine learning (ML) systems indicates that learning from data alone often fails to capture underlying background knowledge.

item.title: Center Focusing Network for Real-Time LiDAR Panoptic Segmentation
item.description: LiDAR panoptic segmentation facilitates an autonomous vehicle to comprehensively understand the surrounding objects and scenes and is required to run in real time.

item.title: SQLNet: Scale-Modulated Query and Localization Network for Few-Shot Class-Agnostic Counting
item.description: In the localization stage, the Scale-aware Multi-head Localization (SAML) module utilizes the query tensor to predict the confidence, location, and size of each potential object.

item.title: GAIA: Delving into Gradient-based Attribution Abnormality for Out-of-distribution Detection
item.description: This perspective is motivated by our observation that gradient-based attribution methods encounter challenges in assigning feature importance to OOD data, thereby yielding divergent explanation patterns.

item.title: FedFusion: Manifold Driven Federated Learning for Multi-satellite and Multi-modality Fusion
item.description: Multi-satellite, multi-modality in-orbit fusion is a challenging task as it explores the fusion representation of complex high-dimensional data under limited computational resources.

item.title: A Reevaluation of Event Extraction: Past, Present, and Future Challenges
item.description: In this work, we first identify and discuss these evaluation challenges, including the unfair comparisons resulting from different assumptions about data or different data preprocessing steps, the incompleteness of the current evaluation framework leading to potential dataset bias or data split bias, and low reproducibility of prior studies.

item.title: Show Your Work with Confidence: Confidence Bands for Tuning Curves
item.description: The choice of hyperparameters greatly impacts performance in natural language processing.

item.title: MAM-E: Mammographic synthetic image generation with diffusion models
item.description: Additionally, we propose using stable diffusion models for the inpainting of synthetic lesions on healthy mammograms.

item.title: Aligning with Whom? Large Language Models Have Gender and Racial Biases in Subjective NLP Tasks
item.description: We find that for both tasks, model predictions are closer to the labels from White and female participants.

item.title: Inherently Interpretable Time Series Classification via Multiple Instance Learning
item.description: Conventional Time Series Classification (TSC) methods are often black boxes that obscure inherent interpretation of their decision-making processes.

item.title: Comprehensive Evaluation and Insights into the Use of Deep Neural Networks to Detect and Quantify Lymphoma Lesions in PET/CT Images
item.description: This study performs comprehensive evaluation of four neural network architectures (UNet, SegResNet, DynUNet, and SwinUNETR) for lymphoma lesion segmentation from PET/CT images.

item.title: Pachinko: Patching Interpretable QA Models through Natural Language Feedback
item.description: In the first one, we present users with incorrect answers and corresponding rationales of various formats and ask them to provide natural language feedback to revise the rationale.

item.title: How Far Can We Extract Diverse Perspectives from Large Language Models? Criteria-Based Diversity Prompting!
item.description: We formulate this problem as diversity extraction in LLMs and propose a criteria-based prompting technique to ground diverse opinions and measure perspective diversity from the generated criteria words.

item.title: DeepEMD: A Transformer-based Fast Estimation of the Earth Mover's Distance
item.description: We propose an attention-based model to compute an accurate approximation of the EMD that can be used as a training loss for generative models.

item.title: RENI++ A Rotation-Equivariant, Scale-Invariant, Natural Illumination Prior
item.description: Training our model on a curated dataset of 1. 6K HDR environment maps of natural scenes, we compare it against traditional representations, demonstrate its applicability for an inverse rendering task and show environment map completion from partial observations.

item.title: AI-based soundscape analysis: Jointly identifying sound sources and predicting annoyance
item.description: (4) Generalization tests show that the proposed model's ARP in the presence of model-unknown sound sources is consistent with expert expectations and can explain previous findings from the literature on sound-scape augmentation.

item.title: Toulouse Hyperspectral Data Set: a benchmark data set to assess semi-supervised spectral representation learning and pixel-wise classification techniques
item.description: Airborne hyperspectral images can be used to map the land cover in large urban areas, thanks to their very high spatial and spectral resolutions on a wide spectral domain.

item.title: Controllable Text Summarization: Unraveling Challenges, Approaches, and Prospects -- A Survey
item.description: Generic text summarization approaches often fail to address the specific intent and needs of individual users.

item.title: Navigating the Ocean of Biases: Political Bias Attribution in Language Models via Causal Structures
item.description: The rapid advancement of Large Language Models (LLMs) has sparked intense debate regarding their ability to perceive and interpret complex socio-political landscapes.

item.title: A Low Rank Approach to Minimize Sensor-to-Actuator Communication in Finite Horizon Output Feedback
item.description: In this work, we are interested in designing a controller that can be implemented with a minimum number of sensor-to-actuator messages, while satisfying safety constraints over a finite horizon.

item.title: Contrastive Transformer Learning with Proximity Data Generation for Text-Based Person Search
item.description: Moreover, we propose a proximity data generation (PDG) module to automatically produce more diverse data for cross-modal training.

item.title: Social Meme-ing: Measuring Linguistic Variation in Memes
item.description: Much work in the space of NLP has used computational methods to explore sociolinguistic variation in text.

item.title: Frequency Domain-based Dataset Distillation
item.description: This paper presents FreD, a novel parameterization method for dataset distillation, which utilizes the frequency domain to distill a small-sized synthetic dataset from a large-sized original dataset.

item.title: Scalable and Effective Generative Information Retrieval
item.description: This paper represents an important milestone in generative retrieval research by showing, for the first time, that generative retrieval models can be trained to perform effectively on large-scale standard retrieval benchmarks.

item.title: Improving Zero-shot Visual Question Answering via Large Language Models with Reasoning Question Prompts
item.description: This results in a set of candidate answers.

item.title: Auto-ICL: In-Context Learning without Human Supervision
item.description: In the era of Large Language Models (LLMs), human-computer interaction has evolved towards natural language, offering unprecedented flexibility.

item.title: NormNet: Scale Normalization for 6D Pose Estimation in Stacked Scenarios
item.description: Existing Object Pose Estimation (OPE) methods for stacked scenarios are not robust to changes in object scale.

item.title: Universal NER: A Gold-Standard Multilingual Named Entity Recognition Benchmark
item.description: We introduce Universal NER (UNER), an open, community-driven project to develop gold-standard NER benchmarks in many languages.

item.title: Assessing Knowledge Editing in Language Models via Relation Perspective
item.description: Knowledge Editing (KE) for modifying factual knowledge in Large Language Models (LLMs) has been receiving increasing attention.

item.title: Data Similarity is Not Enough to Explain Language Model Performance
item.description: Large language models achieve high performance on many but not all downstream tasks.

item.title: Empirical evaluation of Uncertainty Quantification in Retrieval-Augmented Language Models for Science
item.description: This research investigates how uncertainty scores vary when scientific knowledge is incorporated as pretraining and retrieval data and explores the relationship between uncertainty scores and the accuracy of model-generated outputs.

item.title: Safer-Instruct: Aligning Language Models with Automated Preference Data
item.description: Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) is a vital strategy for enhancing model safety in language models.
